Gloves with built-in sensors: Gloves with sensors can track the movements of the hand and fingers, allowing for more precise and intuitive control of devices.
Gloves with haptic feedback: Gloves with haptic feedback can provide tactile sensations to the wearer, making virtual reality experiences more immersive.
Gloves with augmented reality displays: Gloves with augmented reality displays can display information directly on the fingertips, allowing for hands-free access to information.
Gloves with smart grips: Gloves with smart grips can adjust to the shape and size of the hand, providing a more comfortable and secure fit.
Gloves with biometric authentication: Gloves with biometric authentication can be used to verify the identity of the wearer, providing an added layer of security.
